content: I love this game but there are a LOT of bugs lately. App get stuck in a loop when the game is over and when you're using the lavomancy potion.
Excellent game

It's a great game. I play this on a daily basis, so I purchased the expansion. I'm really disappointed because the expansion makes the game buggy. Sometimes it won't let me use potions or even end my turn, and there's no option to report bugs, so I don't know how they know there's issues.
A really fun game, works great in pass an play and online
Boom!
Fun and explosive! The base game is fun to play and the expansions add more options.

Developer is not replying. I want refund on this game, as my younger brother bought this game without my permission and now he is not understanding how to play, so he uninstalled it, so i contacted google play support, they said funds have transferred to developer, he can provide refund, so i contacted developer, but no reply from his side, i want refund.

In the reviews I read, it said that this game plays in landscape automatically on tablets. However it would only play in portrait mode on my tablet (Samsung Galaxy Tab). My tablet case does not allow me to stand my tablet up vertically. So I ended up uninstalling without everything playing.
In bad need of a confirm button
The game itself is phenomenal. The app however is riddled with bugs.

Great digital version with an affordable expansion (currently £1.99). I have encountered a bug with the multiplayer. After quitting one game it did not inform my opponent. I had to let them know separately and they turn also quit.
Excellent adaptation to the board game. One of my favourites, highly recommended! 👌
Love opening up the app to check and see if I have any games to complete. Good for groups.
Notification system seems to work better. Now, if they'd add some sort of chat system, that'd make it 5 stars....
replyContent:
Hello, 

We are deeply sorry about this. 
In order for us to investigate could you please contact the support: 
https://asmodee.helpshift.com/a/potion-explosion/

Best regards,  
Asmodee Digital support

content: End of game is only recognized half of the time. Sprockets just spin. Have to close out game and reopen.

Fantastic and addicting It's got a good variety of potions and professors to keep the game interesting. It's challenging but not super hard, especially once you understand all the potions and how to really get good combinations going. All in all a fantastic game that does the board game justice.
Enjoying the game... Can be tricky to win. Good port of the board game

Nice and colorfull adaptation. Please create a search for online players without the need to be in the active app. For example, you just create a lobby and exit the game. When all the players are found, you get a start notification. There are few online players and waiting takes a long time.

This is honestly one of the best board game adaptations I've seen. The graphics look great, the potion effects as well. Having played the board game prior to this, I actually prefer the app. No setup, no possibility of literally losing ones marbles. The only thing that I don't like is that your starter potions are randomly assigned to you, whereas you get a choice in the actual game. Excellent game and expansion!

GAME NEEDS AN UNDO BUTTON!!! Potion Of Prismatic Joy only allowed me to place one of the three ingredients in my pool into a potion. If you leave the game after clicking a potion, but do not use the ability, when you return to the game the potion will be spent.

The game is ok but very hard to win against even the easy ai. It does not make it fun when it is so hard squeak or a win on easy. I'm scared to see what medium and hard are like. Is probably lose on the first 3 rounds. Glad I got it on sale.
Love this game

I paid for this game and half the time it doesn't count your games or achievements. There is so few players that unless you personally know people who have the game you can only play offline. There is no way to contact customer service to file complaints. The board game is much better.
Fixed version. Great game, no complaints.

Superb game. The digital implementation is one of the best. Love the analog, own it but digital helps if you are alone. One thing though, when you activate a potion, hope you can forgo the action and return back not using it. Also creating online game shouldn't wait til players are joining. Can be on the background.
Haven't been able to play a (solo, haven't tried online) game for more than 5 minutes without it just closing out back to homescreen on Android TV/box.
Fun and addictive.

Lowering to 1 star as I put in a support ticket 3 weeks ago and never received a response. Buyer Beware Asmodee games on Pixel devices. Update: Game is unplayable on a Pixel Slate Tablet. Between that and the problem on the Pixel 3 XL going to lower the rating until that's fixed.
I installed this earlier and had to delete because of problems I was having. Happy to see that those issues have been resolved
Great game but once in a while the offline game gets buggy and the end your turn button stops responding
I love the game, and its my favourite on my phone
Numbers are cut off on a Pixel 3 XL.
addicting

The set up rules are incorrect. I do not get to choose my starting potions. Other than that everything else is flawless. But please update and fix this...its not fun when you are forced with two potions that just don't combo too well and it feels worse when you had no choice with it from the start. It may seem petty, but someone else who has a great set of potions can really pull ahead with points early on, and then you are left stuck with playing catch up the rest of the game.
I'm using android 10 and it stuck on loading screen.
Fun like the board game

Please fix the game, it crashes at the end, when the final score should be displayed Edit : i played 2 games and both of them crashed at the end, just before the final score screen. The game also crashed when I loaded it, at the loading screen, i had to uninstall and reinstall it
Lose edge of screen on Pixel 3XL
fun, well implemented multiplayer
decent digital version
can't see half ot the action options on my screen. its cut off and the app doesn't rotate into landscape.
i can't play because I can't see the other half the screen where all the actions take place

On Pixel 3XL, when you are selecting new potions after completing some is not displayed correctly and you cannot see the numbers. Aside from that, this is my favorite game. Super fun and always different.

My family loves the game. The app has some issues. As other reviews have noted, the app often hangs loading the scoring screen. Also, there is confirmation for just about every choice you make except your main pick, which sucks when you accidentally touch the wrong marble.

User interface is very problematic. Its very easy to mistouch an ingredient and have your game ruined. Why can't we have a validation after choosing an ingredient? Also, when you are choosing potions for replacing a completed one, it would make a big difference to be able to look at opponent's table. There could also be a way to create a game and leave it hanging waiting for other players to join. It's nearly impossible to find opponents without this feature, which is common in other online games
It's a very buggy game that has locked up on me several times now and caused me to have to abandon a game. This is not ok for a game I've paid for.

Why in the world is this still not a thing?? Updated review 6/13/19 The best thing about this app is being able to play with other people but there's hardly any other people on and I've had a game waiting to be joined for way too long. It would be great if you could choose the option to create a game and then have it search for a player or sit in the queue and once it's joined the other player can start the game and then it'll notify you of your turn.
replyContent:
Hello, 

Thanks for your feedback, don't hesitate to contact the support: 
https://asmodee.helpshift.com/a/potion-explosion/

Best regards,

content: This boardgame is perfect for asynchronous play thanks to a very small number of turns per player, each of which being near independent puzzles. This digital port is pretty good! Yet, there is room for improvements: the 6th slot readily visible; the 1st never masked by the eye button; a way to leave the creation of tables before other players join them; games sometimes stall just bf the final score display; a button for random professors selection; better AI; ...
Crashed my tablet entirely, what a shame

A good adaptation of the board game. Unfortunately, it has a tendency to crash on the scoring screen at the end of a game. Also, there's no online matchmaking for multiplayer, so if you want to play against other people, you have to arrange it with friends ahead of time. For single player, it's quite enjoyable, and is a great way to try some different strategies and learn the game.
yes this game is dead.. still a lot of bugs, lack of optimization, and not a single player online, even I couldn't finish all of my single player games because of bugs.. it's such a shame
replyContent:
Hi ✌️
Thank you for your feedback!

We are sorry for the issues you're encountering with Potion Explosion.
For any bug report, please contact our support team here:  https://asmodee.helpshift.com/a/potion-explosion/?fbclid=IwAR1Q_44ZAO-xaqnfbBP1v2a11KUUNX8Gqnu85BzySMZIoQCD2VpB_DBsEn4&p=android

Asmodee Digital

content: Issues connecting to online play. I start a game and invite my buddy and they don't see the game. can't play together.

Love the board game, but as an app it stinks! Impossible to win against the "Easy" robot no matter what you do! The way it's set up it's easy to see your explosions happen, but the robot's happens so fast you can't tell what is going on. He can pull one ingredient and get a ton of explosions. Pretty sure the robot cheats. It might be okay if you enjoy playing online against others, but that's not really my thing and you have to pay to play against any of the professors.
Not working. It doesn't go past the loading screen since last update
Great game, just lacks a community to play online with, once you start beating three computer opponents on hard handily, it looses it's charm, but that's not the fault of the game.
Incredibly fun!

I've played the board game a lot, and never seen such sequences of luck as the computer has in this game. Even on easy, the computer frequently gets outstanding combos and marble drops. Also will often draw high value potions when your given a choice of 3's and 4's. Worth the purchase to be able to play the game on the move, but am sceptical about the "luck" and randomness factor that the Devs have programmed.
I like the theme and the board game but the app have bug and usually get lag. so please fix this problem!!!
It would be nice if it taught you real chemistry. Some of the graphics are neat but over all I'm not in love with kid friendly graphics. Great concept hope to see another version soon.

Pretty true adaptation of the boardgame, but I thought players were supposed to select their starting potions? Also - the AI is pretty tricky. The game is also super battery heavy even with the in-app battery saver enabled.

Perfect "ported" boardgame. Visual and audio queues are nice, great overall 
design, easy to learn and even better when you learn how to optimize your 
turns. Hats off to Horrible Games and Asmodee Digital. The only improvemwnt 
I could think of would be to speed up CPU turns. 5 by 5

Latest update has made the game quite unstable. Had one game hang 
completely and the next just crashed...

Game itself is great. Too many bugs in online play, matches get stuck and

content:
If I was rating this on gameplay, I would give it a very solid 5 stars. The 
graphics, the music, and every decision in the game are wonderful. The big 
issue is that the app itself can be unstable. About half of my games end 
with it crashing, usually right before final scoring. The game really 
deserves a more stable build, and I'm hoping it will be updated soon to fix 
the issues. The only other thing that it's really lacking is an undo 
button. It's really easy to accidentally select the wrong thing, and 
there's no way to back up.
replyContent:
Hello, 

Many thanks for your feedback and support. 
Don't hesitate to contact the support: https://asmodee.helpshift.com/a/potion-explosion/

Best regards, 
Asmodee Digital support

content:
A very fun game, but so many infuriating bugs! 1. Some achievements don't 
get unlocked even after all the requirements are met 2. The game often 
freezes right before the final scoring is done. At this point the app needs 
to be killed. 3. At times all the controls become unresponsive, the only 
choice is to leave the game. Thankfully it's usually possible to resume as 
the state seems to be saved.
Good implementation when it works but it's riddled with bugs.

Hello,

Best regards, 
Asmodee Digital support

content:
The only thing that would make this better is if there was an option to 
play a longer game. Like for example, you go to 8 or 10 ribbons instead of 
4.

EDIT: Just tried the game out again and it seems the launch glitch I was 
experiencing was fixed. I can play the game just fine now and it's working 
very well. Thanks!

content: Won't even log into my Asmodee account.
Often freeze on game finished

Love it! 🤩 Heard about this game and it took me a while to see if I wanted 
to spend money to buy it, and I'm glad I did!! Gameplay is smooth, graphics 
is great. I mostly play the offline mode so I don't really have a problem 
with the online mode. Keep up the great work! 😁

Fun game. Be great if I could play it. First game after purchasing the 
expansion and everything stopped responding. Restarted my phone, and now I 
can't continue that game OR start a new one. Update: I was planning to 
raise my score from one to three, but the game keeps crashing or freezing 
up, including during timed online matches. It even took my turn for me once 
while it was frozen. At least it's partially playable now.

I've never reviewed an app in my life, but the number of bugs I've run into 
is infuriating. I reached out to the support team a week ago, got a canned 
reply, and nothing has been done. Achievements are stuck, games freeze 
after completed, it's so frustrating!

A great game to destroy your friendships. The loading times for opening the 
app and game instances are a bit slow. I've lowered the review from 4 to 3 
stars because some of my recent game instances have desynced and we can't 
play anymore.

I love this game so much. It's so creative and unique and it is an 
excellent adaptation of a well designed board game.

Love the game but having the same issues as others. Since downloading the 
expansion the game freezes. This is not what we paid for.

Still no push notifications after huge update, does the app developer care. 
Online games failed 75% of the time.
The last update broke few things, I'd wait with buying until they are fixed.

Paid for the expansion but it remains locked in my app. Emailed support and 
have not received a response. Changing my rating from 1 star depends 
entirely on having my issue fixed by Wednesday. Thank you.

Now gets stuck on loading screen. Maybe someday get to play this again, 
really hesitant to spend money on 5th element expansion if they can't get 
this working...
Charged for an expansion that doesn't work.

Crashes probably five times every single game. It just freezes, the music 
continues but unresponsive. Force close game, restart. It does save 
progress but I shouldn't have to deal with numerous crashes.

This is my first experience with Potion Explosion. I like it and look forward to exploring the game, but two times now the game has closed for no reason and the game I was playing disappeared. This is not acceptable for an app that I purchased. I purchased the game just last night. Please address this crashing issue. Edit -  I am changing my rating because the crashing issues have returned after getting a new update on the game on about May 17, 2018. I can't get through more than a few moves, sometimes less, without the game crashing.

Good implementation of the game but the lack of push notifications is a 
deal breaker. My iOS brethren constantly need to let me know when their 
turns are taken.
Excellent multiplayer puzzle game. Slow AF load times... :/
The game doesn't start on Google pixel 2016 edition.
Great adaptation of the great game. We enjoy this one a lot!
It doesn't work in the Samsung Galaxy 9+
Won't start on my pixel 2 xl. Just goes to a blank screen

I love the game. The app works well for me in general. It looks good, runs 
smoothly, and the sounds are very fitting. The only thing that I hate is 
there's no notification if I'm playing with a friend, which I just noticed 
as I used to just play against the app. And the time allotment is weird in 
the way that you get a certain amount of total time to play... Like you get 
3 days total. Not 3 days to make a turn, but 3 days to finish the game. It 
desperately needs notifications for online play and really needs to have a 
time set per turn rather than an overall game length.

This needs working notifications. Even an email notification like LoW would 
be better then nothing.

Great game and Asmodee usually makes a great port of table top games but 
they've slightly departed from their usually high standard. I say this for 
two reasons. (1) The game does not seem to notify me when it's my turn, so 
I have to stay in the game or manually enter the game to see if it's my 
turn. Very annoying. (2) When I start a game with, for example, a 3 day 
time limit, this game, unlike every other game, gives us 3 days *total* to 
finish the game, rather than a 3 day time limit per move, like every other 
game I've played. Also annoying. Were it not for these two gripes, I would 
rate this 5 stars. I would love to see Asmodee fix these two issues. I 
would also love to see them bring the expansion to this digital version.
I get a black screen on startup and nothing else on my Google pixel 1

I want to give it a higher rating, I love the board game but alas it won't 
even load on my Samsung S8+
Great game!
Why no push notifications? Come on now...

Bought this game a week ago and it will not even load. Do not waste your 
money.

What a fun game! I own the physical game as well and this is a faithful 
recreation of it.
Won't even start on my galaxy s8.

Update: got the game to work on my Pixel XL. Allowed "Storage" permission 
and voila. The tutorial is instructive and the game is easy to learn. 
Really enjoy this game!

content: Great game, but unfortunately it has stopped working on my samsung s8 please fix this, i love this game!

Most Asmodee Digital adaptations are pretty good. This is crashing on startup on my S8+. Hopefully it gets fixed, would like to try this out. Update: found a post on their support site that storage permissions need to be enabled in app info, which fixed it. From past reviews, it looks like this has been an issue for some time, but still no real fix? +1 star for not being completely broken, but not a very good user experience.
Won't even load on my new phone. Just a black screen

content: In a nutshell, don't waste your money.  I lost games because the software is buggy and just that. Problems on the server caused me to be unable to play. Several times.  Also, they come here and say "contact customer support" when you give them a low score, but they never answer customer support tickets. Useless.  --- Older comments, still valid:  No more push notifications.  Requires permission but doesn't ask for it, you need to set it up manually.  Needs a "lock" for letting you simulate explosions mentally, but letting you tap balls without activating anything. Sometimes I just want to cover a ball with my finger to see it clearly, and missclick.

content: Game no longer loads on airplane mode after update. Used to be perfect for playing in areas with no service or while traveling. It's really frustrating that it now requires a connection to play, when it didn't when first purchased!

This is a great port of the physical marbles & cardboard game. You know what'd make it much better? If I didn't have to forfeit more than half my games because the app gets stuck in a loop or hangs at the end of somebody's turn. Me and a few friends have really been enjoying the online play. But this past week, we've all had to scrap several unfinished games due to some kind of app failure.

The app crashes on startup on my Pixel. Completely disfunctional...  Update: the app developer responded to my negative review and helped me address a very simple technical issue inherent to the Android 8.0 OS. The app now functions nominally on my device.

content: The board game is a lot of fun.  The app however is frustrating. When it was working it was ok but the lack of push notifications and amount of errors on online play was a huge turn off.  I just got a new phone and now the app wont load at all.  I already went in a manually set the storage permission (the fact that you have to manually do this reflects poorly on the developers) but still nothing, I get the loading screen now but never further than that. I expect A LOT more from a paid app.  Have to uninstall since it wont open which means I wasted my money.

This is a great adaptation of the board game, but it really needs an undo button, especially for the autofill button.  There's been too many times for me where the autofill button filled the wrong potion and there's no way to undo that.
I love the board game, this is a great adaptation.  Great graphics, fun strategy and lots of variation.

Great game but encountered a bug.  I set a time limit on the online game and when one person hit zero on time and the app crashed for all users (android and iPhone).  Upon entering the app again and trying to do anything with the game it continually crashes. I'd assume there's a more graceful way of telling the user 'game over'
It's not opening since I updated to Oreo :(. It stays black, all black. I installed it twice already...  I hope it gets fixed soon!

I'm glad I at least bought the digital version to avoid my kids and I killing each other from frustration. All the digital avatars always have the best of luck and take tokens from me left and right. I have yet to win since buying it this morning. It's like playing chess master set to impossible, except the avatars are on easy!  Very disappointed in this game because when I saw it on kickstarter I had high hopes.  Back to playing Sagrada.
The game is great of it works. Lately mine doesn't get past the black loading screen.
Freezes during potion selection then requires restarting the app.
Fantastic game (had the actual board game first), highly recommended. The app can be a little glitchy but still more than worth it.
Awesome graphics, overall fun to play. The AI can complete collisions with off screen marbles; this makes it very hard to beat the AI. Needs an undo option.
Great when it works. It is common to have errors, have games disappear, or be unable to finish games both online and offline. I love the game so we keep playing but it is very frustrating.

Wish I could get a notification when it was my turn. On Android Google pixel

Fun game.

App does not ask for correct permissions on Android Oreo. You have to manually set files permission after install. Game itself is great. Oddly it seems to draft starting portions for you which is really annoying and can really put you at a disadvantage
A satisfying puzzle with nice explosions.

content: Love the game. Excited to see if the Fifth Element expansion will be added in an update.
I like this game, but they made it with so much unnecessary animation that it drains your battery. I'd rather have less animation and more play time

content: It's a great game i first played as a board game. Fun to be able to play with friends without having to be together. Need to fix the bugs that get you stuck on your move though. Several times i've taken my move then when I've came back to see who's turn it was up to I've had to take the exact same move again like i'd not done it before. This has happened for my friends too. Can you please look into this? Then it would be five stars.
replyContent:
Hello,

Gameplay is fun and very pretty, but the potion symbols at the bottom of the screen are hard to read; I'm not sure if I'm picking the right potions until it's too late.

content: Excellent adaptation of the board game. Extremely addictive and offers a great multiplayer implementation.  The one downside is that the app is system intensive. Be prepared for slowdown on lesser devices and quick battery drain.  Edit: Haven't seen a single person playing online. A shame, as it's a lot of fun.
Great adaptation of the boardgame.
Pleasant game but is a heavy battery draw.  Do not play unless can readily recharge battery
Great implementation.  Solid play.  Can sell my physical copy now.

This is the most frustrating game! I have played the board game version and love it, but the interface on this is really poor.  I keep getting into a loop where I can't move forward! Don't waste your money.
replyContent:
Hello, 

We just released an update, could you please try it. 
This should solve this issues.

Love the board game and love the app!

content: Excellent game, no issues at all. Should be more popular than it is.
Superb implementation of a good board game. The graphics compliment the slick UI. They replicate the fun of the marbles in the physical game better than I would have thought they could.

Wow, what a great adaptation of the board game. Super impressed with the graphics and playability of this game. I rarely play games on my phone, but this one has earned a spot on my home screen.   It's also a lot quicker to setup & break down than the board game!
A good implementation of a fun board game. Really needs notifications when an opponent plays in an online match, otherwise would be 5*

Like the overall implementation of the digital version. Of course it can't convey the same tactile feel of the marbles clicking like the analog, but a solid game nonetheless. Only complaint, I wish it had a notification system for online games telling you when it's your turn.
I love this board game, and now I get to play wherever I am.  Lots of fun, intuitive controls, and fantastic graphics!
This game is very good. Wish I could turn off the animation. Hope that it will ask for confirmation when tap on the little help (I lost a game because I accidently tab on it)
Great game : ) needs more people to buy this game so theres more players online

This is an extremely enjoyable, well made game overall. There's a surprising amount of depth and planning ahead, which is nice as well. Graphics are beautiful, and controls couldn't be simpler. My only complaint is that the game heats up my device pretty badly. Considering I'm playing on a gaming tablet (the Nvidia Shield K1), that's surprising. It makes me wonder what it does to less powerful devices. Fix this and it would be a five star game. Even as is, it's a game worthy of playing, to be sure.
I love the boardgame and the app does a great job of bringing that game play to my phone.  It would be even better if I were to get a notification when it is my turn when  playing online.

Really well designed game. It is much more interesting than your typical match three style game, but still simple enough to play it casually. Music and visuals are excellent, and the interface is simple yet gives you all information you need. Bravo!
God app but it asks for permission to manage phone calls?! Why?
I like this game a lot, but it keeps crashing before the end of every  offline multi human player match.
replyContent: Good morning bardicfox7, thanks for reporting your issue. We will definitely have a look at it.

content: Great game, funny and intuitive with terrific animations!

This is a rock solid board game to a translation. The only difference is the inability to draft potions at the beginning, but I can accept that. Another review says you can't view the upcoming potions to select but that is incorrect there are a bunch of purple books on your work table that if pressed allow you to see the upcoming potions. I cannot rate this game highly enough!

The game is very fun. But, in 4 games I've come to game breaking bugs twice. I had 2 stored colors and 1 blue in the beakers to the right. I used the rainbow unicorn potion and the beakers to the right didn't blink but the two stored colors did. I proceeded to try to drag the blinking colors to my potion but couldn't. Finally I decided to take one for the team and just click the check mark to finish using the potion without completing the effect. It just sat there and I clicked and clicked like there was no event bound to the click.
replyContent: Good morning Shawn, to be able to use the prismatic joy potion, you need to drag the marble from your storage directly on the sticker of the potion precisely (and not on the potion itself).

content: Such a charming adaptation. Lovingly created, you can tell.

Not a bad implementation however needs a few extra things. Firstly it needs an undo or confirm button for marble pressed, it's too easy to press a marble next to the one you select. You also have no way of seeing the up coming potions available until you are selecting a new one so cannot plan for the future like in the game.  Lastly it would be nice to have the ability to turn off the animations and perhaps even revert the artwork back to that in the physical version.  It's a good game still, better than most other similar games but the real game is still the better option at this time

Really good implementation of the board game but the app needs a lot of work when it comes to power consumption.  I have a Google Pixel and this app drains the battery very very quickly.  In 2.5 hours, I've gone from 100% battery to 37%.
I have been waiting for this game! Love how we can play with friends!!!

This app is fantastic, and true to the physical boardgame. The only difference, which I admit that I miss, is that the starting potions are randomly assigned at the start of the game instead of being drafted by the players. I suspect this change was made to facilitate faster online play. Otherwise, you'd have to wait for multiple notification responses during potion selection before the game even begins. It's a small thing that I'm ok with, but I do prefer the drafting option in the physical game.
Game is great but online play is poor, bad notifications, slow transions, cumbrsome login.
